title: Grazing and Haying Cover Crops with Josh Roe

tasks.task: Conduct a cover crop trial on a farm in North Central Kansas.
subtasks: Choose a suitable field with previous no-till history.
Divide the field into different plots for grazing, haying, and control.
Select appropriate cover crop seed mixtures based on local recommendations.
Plant the cover crops at the recommended时间和weather conditions.
Harvest and evaluate the yield and quality of the hay portion.
Graze cattle on the grazing plot and monitor their performance.
Price the hay and calculate net income based on costs and market prices.
Analyze the effects of cover crops on soil health and future crop yields.
Present findings and discuss the economic viability of cover crops in the region.
Address potential challenges such as weed management and labor costs.

Plant seeds on August 6th using a custom drill.
Monitor growth and apply 8 inches of rain to evaluate yields.

Analyze soil health and crop yield impact.
Address challenges like radishes and turnips in haying.
